intro.p: The GStreamer team is pleased to announce the first release of the unstable 1.5 release series. The 1.5 release series is adding new features on top of the 1.0, 1.2 and 1.4 series and is part of the API and ABI-stable 1.x release series of the GStreamer multimedia framework. The unstable 1.5 release series will lead to the stable 1.6 release series in the next weeks, and newly added API can still change until that point.
Binaries for Android, iOS, Mac OS X and Windows will be provided separately during the unstable 1.5 release series.

bug.summary: Listen on the multicast group for RTP/RTCP packets
tests: Unref element after usage
Protect rtsp transport data.
Tunneled RTSP sessions do not always timeout as expected
rtsp-client: race condition when closing client connection
gst-rtsp-server deadlock while sending response over TCP
media: media_unprepare() is kind of broken
rtsp-client: deadlock when setting session medias to NULL
rtsp-stream: lock not released when leaving bin and transports not removed
rtsp-server: deactivate media when shutting down from paused
rtsp-client: add stream transport to the context
rtsp-client: Can not allocate ports for interleaved traffic in setup
add retransmission support
crash when reciving a rtcp after teardown but before client finalize.
configure: add --disable-examples switch
Examples: Accept a 'port' argument for running multiple instances
Remove URI-escaping of RTSP session-id
Crash when two treads are in handle_new_sample at the same time.
Add support for RECORD
When system time is increased the ongoing RTSP sessions will time out.
RTCP packets not sent
gst-rtsp-server does not preroll when piping data into the media-pipeline
Losing the first packet
gst-rtsp-server: uninitialized clock rate causes critical warning
gst-rtsp-server: doesn't perform retransmission to both streams in test-video-rtx
autogen.sh fails due to autopoint erroring out due to missing gettext version in configure.ac
Client have problem to find the teardown response.
